question_content: Does the game contain any sensitive content (Sexual Content/Nudity, Violence/Gore, Drugs/Alcohol/Tobacco, Religious/Political)? (If not mentioned, answer “N/A”)
synthesis_answer: {None: 2366, True: 159}

question_content: List the sensitive content mentioned, if any.
synthesis_answer:
- Story heavily features BL; Cao Cao × Yuan Shao CP repeatedly cited. [45224412, 45071055, 44970107, 44970181, 44965046]
- Many call it otome/BL-focused; male cast criticized as feminized. [45040402, 44967861, 45046494, 44962693, 44170793]
- Sexualization: exaggerated breasts and overt fanservice for female characters. [45402566, 44995110, 44989624, 43960224, 43770394]
- Splash art shows busty women, but main story lacks women. [45639844]
- Fanservice inconsistency: women over-clothed; men frequently bare chests. [44986246, 44962558, 44334076]
- Hot springs removed; worries about NTR and romance discomfort. [45340882, 44918754, 45010037]
- Requests for shirtless male skins and more male fanservice. [44978010]
- Adult-content references noted (eroge jokes, “H” memes). [44878050, 43828793]
- Male voice acting described as overly effeminate. [44996674, 44971613]
- BL themes seen as disrespecting historical Three Kingdoms figures. [44958326, 44969230]
- Female players: not true otome; overwhelmingly male–male CP. [44989624, 44986246]
- Plot shows abuse: blind woman insulted, elderly bullied, refugees suffering. [45639844]
- Mentions of massacre and a woman abused to death. [45127200]
- Scene of students attacking a teacher criticized as inappropriate. [44961549]
- Early story features tavern drinking scenes. [44970310]
- Accusations of feminist agenda and ideological “bias/private motives.” [45229892, 44994330, 44971794, 44960994, 45752334]
- Concerns about creeping “political correctness.” [44334540]

question_content: Summarize the core combat mechanics (or “N/A” if not mentioned).
synthesis_answer:
- Core combat: 6v6 on 9-grid, shared energy; manual skill vs normal attack matters. [44969601, 44961133, 45071055]
- Action bar speed and push/pull bars heavily influence turn order and outcomes. [45009030, 45034141, 44668504]
- Programmable auto-battle rules exist; useful but limited targeting and intelligence. [44358334, 44975709, 44961878]
- Combat rewind/backtrack lets retry decisions, improving tolerance in tough fights. [45653611, 45035639, 45063325]
- Environmental interactions (firepots, screens, pigs, horses) add tactical effects and shortcuts. [45009030, 45071055, 43759823]
- Many stages force manual play, puzzles, or restrictions; automation often disabled. [45135144, 45010410, 45248185]
- Chapter finales frequently cannot auto or skip, slowing pacing. [44961964, 44973131, 44996910]
- Interrupt mechanics are mandatory in several PvE encounters. [45008393, 46278242]
- Burn vs poison timing: burn applies pre-turn, poison post-turn, impacting strength. [45256834, 45125599]
- Fire burn team dominates PvE and PvP; massive cross-power victories reported. [45240404, 45174733, 45098837]
- Cao Ren and Zhou Tai provide extreme mitigation, neutering direct damage builds. [45240404, 45125599]
- Backline-targeting threats make frontliners feel irrelevant; protection tools lacking. [45024942, 44967553, 44975611]
- PVP outcomes skew toward initial speed and push-bar openers. [44668504, 45034141]
- Real-time PVP is slow, hard to match, and widely disliked. [44990375, 45117688]
- Auto/skip PVP often reduces fights to battle power comparisons. [44970227, 44961101]
- Tower modes reward positioning and lineup tinkering; some find them satisfying. [45340882, 44993870, 44961133]
- Early dual-team requirements increase grind and frustrate players. [45071439, 45596937, 45254175]
- Energy economy encourages frequent normal attacks; many heroes have one active nuke. [45008393, 44968179]
- Skill texts are lengthy; learning all effects feels overwhelming. [45006131, 44967219]
- Auto AI can mis-target under special rules, failing star conditions. [45047857, 44961878]
- Cleansing and resist feel weak versus heavy debuffs; healing often countered. [45098837, 45125599]
- Later updates introduced counters to fire (cleanse, anti-pull, push immunity). [46411680]
- Post-update, poison (Hua Tuo), Wang Yi, and Pang Tong teams became viable. [46411680]
- Unique differentiator: action bar + scripting + speed adds strategic depth beyond raw stats. [46411680, 45009030]

question_content: Rate combat satisfaction: -2 (very negative) to 2 (very positive) or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
- Players praise innovative combat: action bar, energy management, speed control, and rewind depth. [46411680, 45653611, 45009030, 45034282]
- Many enjoy strategy-focused manual decision-making in challenging stages. [45151865, 46182391, 43759823, 46278242]
- Frequent complaints about forced manual stages; auto-battle AI feels dumb or cumbersome. [45010410, 45140922, 45248185, 44972532, 44973131]
- Auto-battle configuration is powerful but complex; targeting limitations frustrate players. [44358334, 44975709, 44961878, 45172117, 45069728]
- PVP satisfaction is low: whale matchmaking, slow real-time battles, limited control. [44990375, 44985187, 44961101, 44984870, 45392710]
- Fire burn teams dominate PVE/PVP, causing severe balance dissatisfaction. [45378257, 45507260, 45256834, 45174733, 45003018]
- Some note balance improvements; fire no longer singularly dominant. [45249294, 46411680, 45866343]
- PVE difficulty spikes and gimmicks (e.g., 100% resists) feel unfair. [45259115, 45255637, 45190851]
- Protecting backline feels ineffective; assassinations decide matches quickly. [45024942, 44967553]
- Combat pacing criticized as slow and repetitive; animations lack impact. [44968179, 45199510, 44959955, 44957628]
- Some find combat enjoyable and more interesting than the first game. [44977479, 45034282, 45653611, 44993870]
- Strategy often overshadowed by power gaps and stat checks. [45190851, 44969462, 44968179, 45014560]

question_content: List the strategic/tactical features mentioned, if any.
synthesis_answer:
- Action bar plus auto-logic and speed define core strategy. [46411680]
- Nine-grid positioning significantly impacts battles. [45340882]
- Shared energy (war intent) requires prioritizing skill usage. [45071439, 44961133]
- Manual control is often required for hard stages. [46182391, 44360343]
- Auto-battle scripting supports conditional skills and targets. [45056296, 44358334]
- Turn order planning and dynamic skill conditions matter. [44990378]
- Speed tuning, push/pull action bars decide battle tempo. [44668504, 44358334]
- Time rewind enables in-battle retries and experimentation. [45063325, 44965546]
- Environmental objects (screens, fire basins) trigger tactical effects. [45009030, 44961133]
- Gimmick stages like “hit pig to stun archer”. [43759823]
- Interrupt mechanics are critical in many encounters. [44964613, 45008393]
- Arena supports manual play; high ranks add ban-pick. [45166654]
- Some modes require two squads, forcing roster planning. [45167797, 45243971]
- Class switching via awakening enables role flexibility. [45063325, 44961878]
- Skill order, stationing, and speed tuning drive clears. [45031733, 45335892]
- Status timings differ: burn pre-turn; poison after action. [45167402, 45256834]
- Anti-fire tools include dispel, pull reduction, push immunity. [46411680]
- Backline sniping bypasses tanks, shaping protection tactics. [45024942, 44975611]
- Faction or role-restricted stages demand specialized lineups. [45167797, 45214733]
- Three rewinds increase tolerance for mistakes. [45063325]
- Auto-logic lacks granularity for buff target assignment. [44975709]
- Some stages enforce basics-only or achievement constraints. [44978562, 44360343]

question_content: Rate strategic/tactical depth: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• “Action bar + auto code + speed = strategy.” [46411680]  
• Interactive battlefield elements (firepots, screens, horses) add situational tactics. [44961133, 43759823]  
• Tower stages praised for positioning and lineup puzzles. [45340882, 45036016]  
• Many PVE checks feel number-gated, undermining tactics. [45270483, 45130402]  
• Manual play often required; auto vs manual gap is large. [45266161, 45129968]  
• Auto-battle scripting is deep but imperfect for advanced goals. [44358334, 44975709]  
• Frequent constraints and hand-control interrupts make strategy feel cumbersome. [45152113, 44989275]  
• Build diversity debated: some enjoy creative combos, others see one-meta dominance. [44996307, 45167797]  
• PVP strategic depth is undercut by fire-burn meta dominance. [45174232, 45167402]  
• Speed tuning and skill order matter; thoughtful sequencing enables wins. [45031733, 45071439]  
• Some prefer relaxed auto-play; puzzle-like stages frustrate them. [45138000, 45167201]  
• Strategy demands multi-team investment; forced counters stall progress. [45243971, 45167797]  
• Tactical planning can let F2P occasionally beat stronger teams. [45045440, 44996307]  
• Turn-order inconsistencies and unclear rules hurt strategic clarity. [44360343, 45152113]  
• Frequent gear/skill reconfiguration for tasks reduces tactical enjoyment. [45259670, 45071439]

question_content: Rate game progression: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• Early progression smooth; after 7–14 days, resource faucet dries up. [45268943, 45199902, 45184112]
• “After 14 days, ‘zero improvement’.” [45268943, 45252174]
• Resources are mostly one-time; daily loops yield negligible growth. [45268387, 45245727]
• Stamina gating is severe; buying stamina feels mandatory. [45203404, 44986125]
• Daily currency often can't fund a single 10-pull per week. [45244761, 45172880]
• Multi-team requirements arrive by day 7–10, overwhelming resources. [45071686, 45167797]
• Later, some modes require three teams, exacerbating grind. [45646883, 44978681]
• Gear progression via hammers is slow; set pieces rarely complete. [45103838, 45164375]
• Equipment reforging/stat washing is costly and frustrating. [45740980, 45123620]
• Awakening/profession branches need scarce dragon beads; monthly limits stall progress. [46278242, 45866343]
• Respec is limited; invested resources can't be reclaimed. [44970107, 44360343]
• Gacha progression demands many duplicates; 50-pull pity strains F2P. [45119113, 45221792]
• Limited-time banners and exclusive weapons gate power growth. [45223558, 44978681]
• PVE walls require specific units; immunities like 100% physical block progress. [45259115, 46051056]
• Box depth dictates rewards; failure reduces resources, forming a loop. [45400553, 45247676]
• Many rewards are ranking-gated, stalling casual progression. [44978681, 45177407]
• Post-launch updates reportedly increased welfare and lowered difficulty. [46411680, 45866343]
• Tower after floor 480 switched to single-team, easing progression. [46411680, 45866343]
• New systems (sigils, fishing) reduced PVE push difficulty. [46411680]
• Micro-spenders say progress still lags whales late-game. [46462818]
• Progress pace feels slow; daily play becomes 5–20 minutes. [45237279, 45184112]

question_content: Rate hero balance: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• Early meta: Fire (Wu) dominated PvE and PvP, crossing tens of thousands of power. [45240404, 45174243, 45270183, 45370857]  
• Fire core units overpowered: Zhou Yu/Lu Xun DPS plus Cao Ren/Zhou Tai mitigation. [45240404, 45037096, 45167402]  
• Players nickname it “Fire Burn Continent.” [45049747, 45174232, 45084079, 45033834]  
• PvE design often favors Fire; modes reward AoE/DOT and burn stacking. [45167402, 45240404]  
• Extreme immunities (100% physical/magic) gate non-Fire comps, causing frustration. [45255637, 45347438, 46051056]  
• Poison underpowered: lower coefficient, post-action tick, easily dispelled. [45134649, 45097958, 45339672]  
• Fire countermeasures sometimes backfired, weakening poison or other teams. [45035384, 45500254]  
• Group faction struggles; lacks healers; many feel backstabbed by balance. [45041798, 45795713, 45152345]  
• Shu frequently cited as weakest; repeated losses to Fire reported. [45141116, 44643623, 45270183, 45068999]  
• Shields seen as ineffective; protection undervalued versus burn mechanics. [45125599, 45396118, 45158875]  
• “No waste general” claim disputed; meta diversity overshadowed by Fire dominance. [45232396, 45197043, 44995396]  
• Later patches targeted Fire and broadened options (Wang Yi, Pang Tong, Hua Tuo). [46411680, 45249294, 45859822]  
• Some perceive improved balance; others still see Fire on top. [46130764, 45249294, 45035211]  
• Wang Yi viewed as current T0; concerns about numeric power creep. [45866343, 46278242, 45859822]  
• Community requests nerfs/buffs: curb Fire or strengthen other factions. [45034294, 45033920, 45042876, 45036535]

question_content: Rate hero/team build diversity: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
- Fire team dominates PVE and PVP; other builds feel unviable. [45403235, 45236251, 45235681, 45186207]
- Fire frequently beats much higher power teams by large margins. [45270183, 45286672, 45240404, 45031804]
- Arena/rankings show mirror matches; variety is minimal. [45370857, 45045880, 45108162, 45035211]
- “No waste heroes” disputed; many say only fire is usable. [45172880, 45193620, 45015475]
- Some report improved diversity post-patch: poison, Wei, Shu now playable. [46411680, 45036625, 45061449]
- Current meta lists five archetypes; fire reportedly less unstoppable. [46411680]
- Wei/Shu/巾帼 often considered weak, limiting viable choices. [45184286, 45269126, 45252226]
- Players feel forced to pick fire from the start. [45394043, 45006785, 44997604]
- PVE requires 2–3 teams, pressuring resources and experimentation. [45193620, 45167797, 44978681]
- Some content reportedly favors fire/DoT mechanics, reducing diversity. [45167402, 45167619, 44999053]
- High star/gear/weapon requirements gate alternative builds. [45167797, 45071439, 46278242]
- Class branches exist, but optimal roles are fixed; practical variety limited. [45071055, 44329062]
- Resonance/shared levels lower switching costs, encouraging early trials. [44745548, 44850906, 46411680]
- Roster feels small, further limiting team variation. [46395064, 44957272, 45125956]
- Some suggest buffing other factions instead of only nerfing fire. [45070122, 45252226]
- “Play fire, that’s it.” [45007468]

question_content: Describe the secondary core loop (or “N/A”)
synthesis_answer:
- Daily login to collect hammers, stamina, and idle resources; then log off. [45274386, 45302016, 45103838]
- Use hammers to randomly forge gear; slow, set completion often blocked. [45267744, 45269522, 45124203]
- Fish in Three Mountains for small currency; low payouts, infrequent big rewards. [45484616, 45034414, 45107299]
- Do daily quests and guild activities for limited currency and tickets. [46278242, 45166654, 45172227]
- Complete 10 Arena matches daily; win quotas, inconsistent matchmaking, minor rewards. [45185280, 44998001, 45044690]
- Push Tower and Arsenal for one-time rewards and hammer income. [45051197, 45193620, 45069008]
- After 14 days, routine shrinks to fishing, forging, minimal fights. [45241453, 45302016, 45129766]
- Spend currency to buy stamina; clear stamina quickly on sweeps. [45051197, 45019318, 45107299]
- Publish and assist in help fights for limited daily helper coins. [44998001]
- Weekly bosses and shops reset; monthly shops offer few pulls. [45193620, 44959682]
- Maintain two teams for later tower; daily progress stalls without. [45193620, 45042340]
- Configure auto-combat scripts; adjust action bars for hands-off PvP. [45166654, 44961133]
- Collect daily sign-ins; limited events provide mostly one-time rewards. [45166654, 45044690]
- Use Three Mountains hub to fish, browse deals, drip resources. [44998001, 46278242]
- Clear daily mainline unlocks, then wait for next chapter. [45069008, 45034129]

question_content: Does the secondary loop match tycoon/crafting (e.g. Township, Hay Day)? (True/False/“N/A”)
synthesis_answer: {None: 2479, False: 41, True: 5}

question_content: Rate simplicity of the secondary loop: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
- Daily loop extremely light; after two weeks, play 5–10 minutes then logout. [45302016, 46278242, 45274386]
- Many treat it as a low-commitment idle collect-and-logout experience. [45035774, 45003623, 45042340]
- Meta progression feels convoluted: random hammer-forged gear and difficult set completion. [45267744, 45051197, 45254175]
- Equipment management lacks convenience; re-equipping and UI usability frustrate players. [45124235, 44977750]
- Guidance and tasks feel confusing; too many daily/weekly/monthly chores. [44984511, 44360343, 44329062]
- Ongoing resource income is scarce; most rewards are one-time, stalling progression. [45166654, 44959682, 45172227]
- Early two-team requirement increases burden and complexity. [45042340, 45254175, 45069008]
- Some find fishing and Three Mountains systems relaxing and simple. [44998001, 44961782]
- Unlock pacing is slow; goals clear but content gating drains momentum. [44961133, 44725256]
- Later updates added content and reduced grind, improving daily loop simplicity. [46411680]
- A minority report easier lower-tier gear collection (purple sets). [45131260]
- PVP auto and assistance workflows feel cumbersome and time-consuming. [44998001, 45044690]
- High cognitive load from talents, awakenings, exclusive weapon upgrades. [45194548, 45254175, 45069008]
- Some consider resource and unlock flow acceptable or manageable. [44961018]

question_content: Rate resources earned from the secondary loop: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
- Resource income collapses after the 14‑day newbie period; most rewards are one‑time. [46278242, 45241453]
- Daily draw currency is scarce; players often can’t even afford a ten‑pull. [45484616, 45124203]
- No free daily pull; post‑tutorial draws rely on grinding Three‑Mountains currency. [46278242]
- After mainline ends, daily tasks give few pulls; 2–3 days per targeted gold. [45071439]
- Monthly shop refresh offers limited shards, tickets, and weapon pieces. [45193620, 44959682]
- Awakening gems and similar bottleneck items have monthly‑limited supply. [46278242, 44959682]
- Guild/PvP are key for progression currency; avoiding them slows resource gain. [45044690, 45172227]
- Weekly guild dividends and the weekly boss provide recurring rewards; world boss is one‑time. [45172227]
- Some upgrade stones require co‑op; low population makes grouping difficult. [45484616, 45123620]
- Hammers for gear crafting are the main repeatable income, roughly ~100 daily. [45193620, 45051197]
- Hammer supply feels insufficient; RNG makes completing gear sets frustratingly slow. [45267744, 45198318]
- Fishing and scroll minigames yield low‑value rewards; jackpots are extremely rare. [45484616, 44749038]
- Stamina is tight; progression slows sharply without buying extra energy. [45051197, 45152113]
- Event rewards are sparse; resource output and activity count feel low. [45274386, 45185280]
- Daily loop devolves to fishing and smashing gear; little meaningful progression. [45241453, 45103838]
- Some positive: early purple sets via hammers are easy to assemble. [45131260]
- Later update reportedly increased activities, welfare, and eased progression. [46411680]
- Marketing promises like “1000 pulls” require grinding many events; unrealistic early. [45484616, 45034129]

question_content: Rate frequency of content/meta updates: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
- At launch, content cadence felt stagnant; main story stopped within ~10 days. [45146215, 45154646, 45114865]
- Players report biweekly updates with long idle periods between. [45305533, 45237279]
- Events were sparse; many days offered nothing new to play. [45225398, 45035872, 45139538]
- Holiday updates were minimal; Dragon Boat Festival gave mostly sign-ins. [45117828, 45115505, 45109421, 45078487]
- Content often drip-fed; main story released over multiple days. [45248398, 45234925, 45239694]
- Many reach a long content drought within 1–2 weeks. [45280407, 45253784, 45165218]
- Early meta stagnated; fire team dominated without timely nerfs. [45051416, 45197043, 45279226]
- Later updates targeted fire dominance; broader balance improved. [46411680, 45859822, 45655517, 46130764]
- Despite improvements, production speed remains low; core modes update slowly or pause. [45866343, 45258839, 45279226]
- Communication on updates criticized; silent operators ignore feedback. [44966725, 44341105, 45172880]
- Some note steadier updates since July; more events and welfare added. [45245481, 45258839, 46411680, 45078370]
- Meta shifts often arrive via new limited units, not system changes. [45010336, 45866343]
- Players still ask when updates are coming. [46443127]

question_content: Does the game have a gacha guarantee system? (True/False/“N/A”)
synthesis_answer: {None: 2449, True: 75, False: 1}

question_content: Briefly describe the gacha guarantee system if answer to previous question is True, else answer “N/A”
synthesis_answer:
• Many report a 50-draw pity for gold units. [45293460, 45071439, 44737772, 44995390]
• Some mention different pities: 60 or 40 draws. [45102549, 45103674, 45272572]
• Wishlist pool: daily first gold is guaranteed from your two picks. [45071439, 44625268]
• Faction pool: first gold is guaranteed from the selected faction. [45071439]
• Weapon/Relic pool uses wishlist guarantee, but off-banner can occur. [45071439, 44971613]
• Limited banners use “mi-pool” 50/50 soft pity, then guaranteed. [45221792, 44998001]
• Limited pity cost cited: ~10k jade soft, ~20k jade hard. [44978681]
• Some limited banners lack cumulative (step-up) rewards, e.g., Yuan Shao. [45795713]
• “Always pity” experiences are common. [44970119, 44967437, 44965354]
• One claims 3.3% rate but feels much lower. [45510932]

question_content: Rate reasonableness of gacha pull price: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• Many view “raise price then half off” pricing as deceptive. [45102182, 44960347, 45225571]  
• CNY 648 ≈ 40 pulls; pity is 50, so no guarantee. [45225571, 45293460]  
• Estimated price: about ¥10 per pull; discounted deals ¥5–6. [46278242]  
• Limited packs varied: 10-pull ¥36 early, then ¥60 later. [45236455]  
• Some report half-price 10-pull costing ¥30, still criticized. [44325848]  
• Battle pass: 60 pulls ¥49 (≈1 pity); later similar value ¥180. [45221792, 45172887]  
• Pull rate in jade: 2000 jade per 10-pull; daily ≈1000 jade (~5 pulls). [45102182, 46278242]  
• Limited “mi-pool” pity: 10k–20k jade per copy; some paid 25k. [44978681, 45225476]  
• Completing a unit may need 120k+ jade; seen as unaffordable. [45306999, 44978681]  
• Frequent pity hits make effective cost per gold feel high. [44965354, 45181896, 45010814, 44967437]  
• Some praise half-price and store cuts as cheap and fair. [45475477, 45043598, 44960633, 44969940, 44967443]  
• Others say half-price but overall pricier than competitors. [44960499]  
• After two weeks, free pull income collapses, making pulling feel pricey. [45484616, 45510932, 45155023, 45126275]

question_content: Rate major feature access for non-paying users: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• Many report F2P progression halts after day 14 as resources stop. [45268943, 45144365, 45230638]
• "Only 14 days for F2P." [45241299, 45225488]
• Daily pulls insufficient; some can’t even form one 10-pull weekly. [45119113, 45107299, 45144365]
• No daily free single pull; wish pools become hard to use. [46278242, 44971794]
• Multi-team requirements (2–3 teams) arrive early, blocking non-spenders. [45398169, 45392163, 45295015]
• Cross-server/arena often force three teams; F2P lose consistently. [45395214, 44985187, 44984870]
• Event rewards tied to rankings; F2P largely “cannon fodder.” [44978681, 45177407, 45185280]
• Events demand specific factions/lineups; non-payers miss full rewards. [45407864, 45378505, 45403904]
• Auction‑only limited heroes introduced; effectively paywalled content. [44978681]
• Attribute skins are paid and pricey; F2P lack those stats. [44978681, 45866343]
• Some later report free skins and stronger welfare. [46411680, 45866343]
• Stamina/progression gating via paid packs limits F2P playtime. [45203404, 45006280, 45172880]
• Gear progression tied to PVE RNG; very slow without spending. [45185280, 45246354, 45103838]
• Battle pass/war orders give poor free value; extra pulls paywalled. [45221792, 45235045, 45866343]
• Early systems (resonance, no‑loss swapping) ease F2P onboarding. [44971645, 44719270, 46278242]
• A minority say F2P/low spend can play casually. [45879540, 44960705, 45035774]

question_content: Rate spending pressure: -2 (heavy/annoying) to 2 (elegant/subtle), or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• After 14 days, resources dry up; progress stalls without spending. [45186800, 45144365]
• Daily income often can’t afford a single 10-pull. [45107299, 44960886]
• “不氪玩不了” widely echoed. [45645429, 45180707]
• Early two/three-team requirements force higher spending. [45646883, 45071686]
• Limited “mi-pool” needs many duplicates; extremely costly. [44978681, 45223076]
• New heroes outclass old; continuous spending to keep up. [44978681, 45225962]
• Duplicate refunds are meager; spenders feel punished. [45537158, 45119113]
• Skins add stats (e.g., +2% attack), creating pay edges. [45078370, 46150031]
• Auction-only heroes escalate monetization pressure. [44978681, 45169599]
• Battle pass segmented/low value; perceived disguised price hikes. [44994544, 46023167]
• “Permanent half-price” seen as markup-then-discount. [45600049, 45051197]
• Stamina and key resources monetized; free play hits walls. [45203404, 44971869]
• Rank-tied rewards favor spenders; low-spend feel sidelined. [45407864, 45866343]
• Channel vs official discounts create unfair spending pressure. [44956469, 44950941]
• Some say micro-spend works; monthly cards best value. [46278242, 45866343]
• Even high spenders report poor ROI and regret. [45033197, 45002102]
• Gacha feels expensive (~¥10 per pull); weak value. [46278242, 45102084]
• After “1000 pulls” promo, later draws scarce without paying. [45103247, 44971393]
• Recent updates/servers reportedly improved welfare for newcomers. [46411680, 45866343]

question_content: Rate quality/quantity of free rewards: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
• Free rewards are frontloaded; mostly one-time within the first 7–14 days. [45245727, 45257446]

• Daily special draws limited; recruit tickets handed singly, slowing F2P progress. [44967030, 44962265]

• Event rewards feel minimal; festival freebies mocked (e.g., 20 hammers). [45401182, 44978681, 45118856, 45225962]

question_content: Does the game integrate IP? (True/False if says none/“N/A” if not mentioned). Briefly describe.
synthesis_answer: {None: 2436, True: 89}

question_content: Briefly describe the IP if answer to previous question is True, else answer “N/A”
synthesis_answer:
- Direct sequel leveraging the Three Kingdoms Fantasy Continent IP. [45001212, 44962988]
- Story focuses on young Cao Cao, highlighting Cao–Yuan dynamics. [45097289, 44970162]
- Built on the classic Three Kingdoms IP to attract fans. [43970227, 43814287]
- Integrates Han-dynasty motifs with modern mech/tech aesthetics. [43966303, 45001212]
- Portrayals skew otome/BL; many accuse it of “selling fu”. [44978689, 44977361]
- Feminized or childlike redesigns of male generals draw backlash. [44984819, 44201203]
- Original characters/renamings and altered romances questioned for accuracy. [44958035, 44144679]
- Some say it feels more like the company’s otome title “Daihao Yuan.” [44978681, 44965810]
- Isekai-like setup broadens the world beyond strict history. [45097289]

question_content: Rate IP integration depth: -2 to 2 or “N/A”
Reason for previous question’s rating
synthesis_answer:
- Many feel the game disrespects the Three Kingdoms IP with BL/otome tone. [44999569, 44969230, 44984819, 44958252]
- Frequent criticism of male idol/androgynous designs undermining historical immersion. [44201203, 44957952, 44970181, 44977493]
- Some say it merely skins Three Kingdoms, prioritizing trendy romance narratives. [44978689, 43814287, 44960994, 44996508]
- Portrayals like Cao Cao–Yuan Shao read as OOC and off-canon. [44965515, 45010034, 44970107, 44970181]
- Missing or sidelined iconic figures (e.g., Xiahou brothers) frustrate lore fans. [45010034]
- Fabricated relationships and timeline errors break historical credibility. [44144679]
- Art style mixing Han elements with modern mecha/tech divides players. [45001212, 44970107, 45009030]
- Some praise richer Han-era elements and strong Three Kingdoms atmosphere. [43966303, 44970557]
- A minority commend the youthful Cao Cao perspective as fresh yet faithful. [45097289, 44968690, 45034129, 44970162]
- Others argue the stylistic shift from the first game alienates its IP audience. [44962988, 44961018, 44970107]
- New characters tied to young Cao Cao feel abrupt or out of place. [44961133, 45097289]
- Claims it’s effectively another otome title, not a true sequel. [44978681, 44970181]
- Some argue Cao–Yuan bonds align with established Three Kingdoms fiction traditions. [44962988, 44965375]
- Overall sentiment skews negative on IP fidelity; praise exists but is minority. [44999569, 44984819, 44965375, 45034129]

question_content: Briefly list other issues (not captured by the questions above)
synthesis_answer:
• Returnee server incentives criticized; no recharge rebate for old accounts. [44327915]
• Visuals disliked: feminized males, AI-like art, crude 3D; downgrade from 1. [44326843, 44435428, 45046138, 45040402, 45210614, 45014980, 45391699, 44994058, 44963813]
• Confusion over model switch: "wasn’t it 2D in test, now 3D?" [46477943]
• Performance issues: login spins, freezes, crashes, overheating, heavy battery drain. [44980001, 45079092, 45083009, 45207682, 45010999, 44988934, 44994863, 44963513, 44970756, 44988817, 44994564]
• Server outages and low population; group content unmatched, many dead guilds. [44968272, 44973317, 45037470, 46052259]
• Frequent bugs: battle data errors, stage locks, event verification failures. [45010348, 45010419, 45010446, 45060318]
• UI problems: red-dot spam, mismatched buttons, intrusive popups and chat panel. [45167605, 45152113, 45259670, 45124235, 44358050, 44964847, 44960405]
• Lacking QoL: no one-tap gear swap; manual re-equipping between teams is tedious. [45259670, 45176297, 45124235, 44990258, 44977750]
• Poor device adaptation: full-screen, small-window, foldables; black bars, obstructed text. [45086414, 44389107, 45045409, 44963080, 44958049, 44960264]
• Audio issues: repetitive voice lines; some chapters missing sound. [45866343, 45044602]
• Story criticized: shallow, out-of-character, slow pacing, heavy black-screen transitions. [45639844, 45152113, 45171265, 45127200]
• Player avatar sidelined; feels like an invisible camera observer. [45254175, 44964299, 44978194, 44989315]
• No CG or gallery to revisit artwork; requested viewer feature. [45131662]
• PvP matchmaking unfair: level gaps, repeats, long queues, stallers, whale pairings. [45160911, 45106069, 45085091, 45249587, 45071439, 44984870]
• Arena chest requires seven wins; structure feels punishing. [44985187]
• Surrender and animation friction: cannot exit quickly; recurring upgrade animations. [45085091, 45402566]
• Guild systems problematic: 10-player boss requirement blocks rewards. [45657809]
• Guild wars: power-based matching loops; unfair pairings. [45236866, 45242299]
• Guild rewards and compensation errors; granted items rolled back. [45293460, 45293493, 45308624]
• Mid-event guild cap increase disrupted competition. [45235092, 45226464]
• Timed events inconvenient; narrow participation windows. [46210627, 44980001]
• Regional lock after payments; refunds unresolved. [45056986]
• Cross-channel/OS price disparities in shared servers; unfair pricing. [45010382, 45110178, 44957619, 44961749]
• Deceptive marketing: permanent half-price messaging and login 1000 pulls claims. [45600049, 45035836, 44981589, 44961949, 44962015, 44993651, 44964541]
• Skins add attributes and are overpriced; battle pass lacks skin. [44978681, 45078370, 45300086]
• Battle pass sold in stages; requires repeated purchases. [44994544, 44960613]
• Aggressive monetization prompts: constant recharge pop-ups. [44958389, 44962942]
• Weak responsiveness: feedback ignored; comments deleted; official streams mute criticism. [45245124, 45225410, 45866343, 44962852, 44962002]
• Weak anti-cheat enforcement; clickers dominate rankings unchecked. [45258839, 44997805]
• Newbie guidance lacking; onboarding unclear; no recommended builds. [46182391, 45009100]
• Flow disrupted by forced manual stages; unskippable encounters. [44983697, 44961964, 44961253]
